author: Amy Ratcliffe
title: Fan Art Friday #105 – 200 Days of STAR WARS by Vince Alvendia | Nerdist
text:
Fan Art Friday #105 – 200 Days of STAR WARS by Vince Alvendia Posted by Amy Ratcliffe on February 24, 2017 Share: Films 
When fans learned we’d be getting more Star Wars with the release of The Force Awakens , they were kind of invigorated. They tackled new projects to count down to the film in the hopes of making the in theater date arrive more quickly. Some fans decided to make all the art, fans like artist Vince Alvendia. He committed to 200 Days of Star Wars . That meant he completed a drawing a day leading into the premiere of Episode VII. 
Alvendia said the project nearly killed him and he finished some of the art minutes before midnight. Flipping through the results of the project on Tumblr, I have to say I think it was worth it. I like seeing my favorite characters in Alvendia’s cute and kind of sweet style. Look at Han and Chewbacca: 
Isn’t Chewie’s cranky face adorable? 
And hello, Jabba the Hutt drinking java. Jabba and java. Yes, please. 
More examples from the 200 Days of Star Wars undertaking are in the gallery below. You can visit Alvendia’s Tumblr for more! 
Do you create any sort of fan art? If so, I want to see it. Whether you focus on a specific fandom or pull inspiration from multiple stories and mediums, I’d like to highlight what you do. If you’re interested in being featured in a future edition of Fan Art Friday , get in touch with me at [email protected] with examples of your work. If you’re not an artist, feel free to email me with recommendations for Fan Art Friday! Images: Vince Alvendia Let’s talk all things The Last Jedi Gallery
